description.narrative: To have improved the status of the recipient water course of the River Neman and the Baltic Sea by enhancing the wastewater treatment in the City of Grodno to fulfil the HELCOM recommendations for municipal wastewater treatment.

tag.narrative: 6.3 - By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally.

6.3 - Till 2030 förbättra vattenkvaliteten genom att minska föroreningar, stoppa dumpning och minimera utsläpp av farliga kemikalier och material, halvera andelen obehandlat avloppsvatten och väsentligt öka återvinningen och en säker återanvändning globalt.

title.narrative: Agreement between Sida and NIB on Grodno WW Project
Beslut om insatsstöd till Grodno WW Project

description.narrative: Following a termination of the contract with the Polish construction company Ecolog in June 2019, much efforts by the project stakeholders have been focused on recouping financial resources from the failed contract and the preparations for the tendering of a new main contractor. The retendering for a contract to complete the reconstruction works at the Grodno waste water treatment plant was launched in December 2019. During the process of tendering it was found that the available financial resources would not be sufficient to complete investments necessary to reach compliance with HELCOM requirements. Therefore an application for an additional 2 MEUR NDEP investment grant was submitted by NIB during the spring 2020, which was approved by NDEP in July 2020. Three bids were received on the tender for a new main contractor and Shtang Construction Ltd (Israel) was selected as the winner. A contract between Grodno Vodokanal and Shtang was signed in November 2020 and the planned date for completion is now set to mid November 2022. In parallel to the investments into the upgrading of the Grodno wwtp an institutionalreform in the Belarusian water sector has also been undertaken where the water tariff hasbeen gradually increased. In the beginning of the program the cost recovery level of thewater tariff was at roughly 40%. This level has been gradually increased by continuoustariff increases and by end 2019 the level of cost recovery for Grodno was at 105%. In June 2021 Belarus informed Sida that they wish Sida to terminate all activites relatedto Swedish development cooperation in Belarus. It is still unclear what effect this will have on the Grodno waste water treatment project.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
